results.title: Air all around us
results.brief_description: This film is designed to implement the study of air by developing the following concepts: air is all around us; air is a substance, ie it occupies space, and can be weighed; air exerts pressure from all sides; air expands when it is heated and contracts when it is cooled; air can be compressed.

results.title: Aids to independence
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Vintage Years”.
Outlines how elderly people can be assisted to live independently and the contribution of voluntary agencies in providing meeting places. Lord Morrison of Lambeth, a pioneer of municipal government discusses the role of the community and the program concludes with an extract from an interview with the famous psychoanalyst Professor Carl Jung when he was 85.

results.title: AIDAB: Australia's aid program making a difference
results.creator_credit: Jane Moore and University of Canberra
results.brief_description: The Australian International Development Assistance Bureau (AIDAB) is the Australian Government overseas aid agency. Most Australians are aware of the government’s role in international relief efforts. However this is just a small part of the aid program. Most of the program is directed towards long-term sustainable development. Sustainable development requires long term strategies to help people improve their own social economic circumstances. This 12 minute video gives an outline of Australia’s official overseas development program. It explains why we have an aid program, where and how it is delivered, what types of assistance we provide and the commercial benefits to Australia.

results.title: Aida
results.brief_description: This production of Verdi’s much-loved masterpiece was a triumphant success when it opened at La Scala in December, 1985 and Luciano Pavarotti’s long awaited performance as Radames was greeted with rapturous applause. In this live recording of that production Pavrotti heads an exceptional cast, with Ghena Dimitrova, Maria Chiara, Nicolai Ghiaurov and Juan Pons, all in peak form. Lorin Maazel conducts the Orchestra of La Scala, Milan. Rated: G

results.title: Ah...we humans
results.brief_description: A non-narrated, animated cartoon with humorous sound effects, giving an understanding of how people react when confronted with behaviour patterns different from their own. Deals with a number of concepts related to groups and conflict: cultural awareness, beliefs and ignorance, scarce resources and the value of alliances. No other credits available.
